definition: one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
to lose/to leave behind/to omit/to bequeath/sth lost/involuntary discharge (of urine etc)

sentences.english: I certainly did . The sky was very clear, and we could see for miles and miles.
sentences.chinese: 當然有，天空十分晴朗，我們可以一覽無遺。

sentences.english: The clues to solving them are all around, hidden in plain sight.
sentences.chinese: 解謎的線索到處都是，藏在我們能夠一覽無遺的地方。

sentences.english: It is high and flat ground overlooking everything.
sentences.chinese: 它是高地平原可以一覽無遺。

sentences.english: At the top we had a bird's-eye view of the entire city.
sentences.chinese: 在頂上，我們俯瞰整個城市，一覽無遺。

definition: to take in the whole scene at once/to have a panoramic view
green grass like cushion (idiom); green meadow so inviting to sleep on
tall and erect, reaching through the clouds (idiom); used to describe tall mountain or skyscraper
as far as the eye can see (idiom)
fantastic oddities of every description (idiom); grotesquely shaped
nothing more beautiful can be imagined (idiom)
